summary: This document is an email chain from March 17, 2020, discussing a request from the Attorney General's office for the FBI to contact a woman named Ms. Sarnoff, who claims to have information on the Epstein matter. The emails show coordination between the DOJ and FBI to initiate contact, noting that Ms. Sarnoff had previously reached out to DOJ leadership but had not responded to follow-ups.

persons.name: Ms. Sarnoff
persons.role: Individual with information on Epstein matter
persons.context: She contacted the AG's office claiming to have information on the Epstein case and had previously reached out to DOJ leadership. The FBI is requested to contact her directly.

persons.name: Associate Deputy Attorney General & National Coordinator for Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting the FBI to contact Ms. Sarnoff, coordinating with the AG's office on the matter.

connections.person2: Associate Deputy Attorney General & National Coordinator for Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking
connections.description: Ms. Sarnoff reached out to the DOJ official with information on Epstein, and the official is facilitating FBI contact with her.

events.title: DOJ/FBI Coordination to Contact Informant
events.description: The Attorney General's office requests the FBI to contact Ms. Sarnoff, who claims to have information on the Epstein matter, after she had previously contacted DOJ leadership.
personsInvolved: Associate Deputy Attorney General & National Coordinator for Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking

keyFacts: Ms. Sarnoff contacted the Attorney General's office claiming to have information on the Epstein case.
This was not her first time reaching out to DOJ leadership with purported information.
The DOJ had previously attempted to contact her but she did not return calls or emails.
On March 17, 2020, the AG's office specifically requested the FBI to reach out to Ms. Sarnoff directly.
The email chain shows high-level coordination between the DOJ and FBI regarding a potential witness in the Epstein investigation.
